generated_text:
- road: The cobblestone surface extending from the foreground into the distance, with visible lane markings and curbs, qualifies as a road.
- sidewalk: The paved area along the left and right sides of the road, bordered by curbs and buildings, is designated for pedestrians and is thus a sidewalk.
- building: The structures on both sides of the street, with windows, doors, and architectural details, are clearly buildings.
- wall: The stone wall on the right side of the image, covered in ivy, is an individual standing wall.
- vegetation: The trees and greenery visible in the background and along the sides of the street constitute vegetation.
- terrain: The grassy hill in the background is a terrain feature.
- person: A man in a checkered shirt is standing on the left sidewalk, and a woman is walking on the right sidewalk, both are persons.
- car: A red car is parked on the right side of the road, partially visible.
- pole: A vertical pole with a traffic sign is visible in the middle distance.
- traffic sign: A blue and white traffic sign indicating a no-parking zone is visible on the left side of the road.
- sky: The open sky is visible above the buildings and trees in the background.
